oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Sanctuary
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: 3200 28th Ave N, Collegeville neighborhood, Birmingham, AL

Color photograph of church sanctuary; ground level facing the wood pulpit; six bishop chairs behind pulpit; large framed picture behind bishops chairs; wood pews at bottom of photo; open white door on left; wood paneled ceiling with two light fixtures

Bethel Baptist Church acted as the administrative headquarters for Civil Rights leaders, as Strategy Center for Civil Rights activists, and as a meeting place for the ACMHR (serving as its headquarters until 1961). It also housed the Movement Choir, started at the request of Reverend Fred Shuttlesworth. The building survived several bombings.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African American Churches -- Tennessee
Churches
